questions.question_text: Within the ‘Run Reconciliation’ process, how can the reconciliation be grouped?

choices.C: Country, Business Unit, Corporation, Location, Account
choices.D: Country, Business Unit, Company, Region, Cost Center
choices.B: Country, Department, Company, Region, Cost Center

questions.question_text: By default, which ServiceNow role can read, but not create, a custom license script?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The answer is D.
From page 206 is sam book with course:
The sam_admin role is required to read the custom metric script. The sam_developer role is required to create or modify a custom metric script.

Selected Answer: D
Agree with Stepherbun answer is D

- to create or modify a custom metric script: sam_developer
- to read custom metric script: sam_admin

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/add-custom-license-metric.html

Selected Answer: D
Software license metrics are used for reconciliation to determine your compliance position. License metrics can be defined for users, devices, processors, and cores. What license metrics are available is based on the metric group. Metric groups are either common or tied to a specific software publisher.

Selected Answer: D
Verified in the Learning Course.
"Software license metrics are used for reconciliation to determine your compliance position."

questions.question_text: Which of the following is set in a software entitlement and used during reconciliation to determine your compliance position?

choices.B: They can be deleted or deactivated
choices.C: They cannot until all associated allocations have been removed

questions.question_text: Once downgrade rights have been populated in the Downgrade Rights table, can they be deleted?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
"Once downgrade rights are created and saved in the Downgrade Rights tables, [samp_sw_downgrade_model] and [samp_downgrade_model], the downgrade rights can't be deleted. However, you can deactivate the downgrade rights." (Reference: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/downgrade-rights.html)

I think it's D
Once downgrade rights are created and saved in the Downgrade Rights tables, [samp_sw_downgrade_model] and [samp_downgrade_model], the downgrade rights can't be deleted. However, you can deactivate the downgrade rights.

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/downgrade-rights.html

Selected Answer: D
Users with the sam_admin role can run on-demand reconciliation; users with sam_user role can only view reconciliation results.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer, only the sam_admin can run on demand reconciliation.

questions.question_text: By default, which ServiceNow role can run on-demand reconciliation?
